items.title: [IndigiNews] With habitat affected by wildfires, syilx-led program monitors rattlesnakes
items.content_html:
The Nk'Mip Desert Cultural Centre has received new federal funding to continue its research on how the snakes are adapting to a changing environment

The post With habitat affected by wildfires, syilx-led program monitors rattlesnakes appeared first on Indiginews.

items.title: [Yellowhead Institute] Reflections on ‚ÄúRupture‚Äù: Mark Carney‚Äôs New World Order & an Indigenous Response
items.content_html:
Prime Minister Mark Carney‚Äôs speech in Davos earlier this month received a rare standing ovation from the World Economic Forum. But in his comments to build an alternative system, insulated from great powers, he inadvertently described the Crown-Indigenous relationship, echoing the long-standing dynamics of power and exclusion that shape that relationship. In this Brief, Janna Wale and Michaela M. McGuire (Jaad Gudgihljiwah) expose this connection and ask what this means for Indigenous Peoples (who have long demanded a seat at the table ‚Äì as opposed to being on the menu) to create a different kind of rupture in our own relationships, within and among Indigenous nations.

The post Reflections on ‚ÄúRupture‚Äù: Mark Carney‚Äôs New World Order & an Indigenous Response appeared first on Yellowhead Institute.
